sen.j: 仙石 秀久（せんごく ひでひさ）は、戦国時代 (日本)から江戸時代前期にかけての武将・大名。
sen.e: Hidehisa SENGOKU was a busho (Japanese military commander) and daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) from Sengoku period (period of warring states) to the early Edo period
Hidehisa SENGOKU was a busho (Japanese military commander) and daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) from the Sengoku period (period of warring states) to the early Edo period

sen.j: 信濃国小諸藩の初代藩主。
sen.e: He was the first lord of domain of Komoro Domain in Shinano Province.
He was the first lord of domain of Komoro Domain in Shinano Province.

sen.j: 出石藩仙石家初代。
sen.e: He was the first family head of the Sengoku family of Izushi Domain.

sen.j: 豊臣秀吉が織田信長に仕えていた頃からの最古参の家臣である。
sen.e: One of the oldest vassal of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, he had been a vassal since Hideyoshi served Nobunaga ODA.

sen.j: 秀吉の家臣団では最も早く大名に出世した。
sen.e: He was the first to be promoted to daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) among Hideyoshi's vassals.

sen.e: He was the first to be promoted to being daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) among Hideyoshi's vassals.

sen.j: 戸次川の戦いで独断専行により、島津軍に大敗を喫したことで有名である。
sen.e: He is notorious for having totally defeated by Shimazu's army in the Battle of Hetsugi-gawa River because of his arbitrary decision and execution.

sen.j: 戸次川の戦いでの大失態を小田原征伐で見事に挽回した。
sen.e: He recovered his fiasco in the Battle of Hetsugi-gawa River by succeeding in the conquest and siege of Odawara.

sen.j: 大名に返り咲くことができた数少ない武将である。
sen.e: He was one of the few busho (Japanese military commander) that was able to take up his old position as daimyo.

sen.j: 石川五右衛門を捕らえたともいわれている。
sen.e: He is said to have seized Goemon ISHIKAWA.

sen.j: 天文21年（1552年）1月26日、美濃の豪族・仙石久盛の四男として美濃で生まれる。
sen.e: On January 26, 1552, he was born in Mino to be the forth son of Hisamori SENGOKU, a Gozoku (local ruling family) of Mino.

sen.j: 仙石氏は清和源氏である土岐氏の支流を自称するが、正しくは不明である。
sen.e: The Sengoku clan claimed themselves to be a branch family of the Toki clan, Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan), but it is not clear if this is true.

sen.j: はじめ越前国の豪族・萩原伊予守国満の養子となる。
sen.e: He was adopted into Kunimaro Iyonokami HAGIWARA, a Gozoku of Echizen-no-Kuni.

sen.j: しかし相次ぐ兄の死により呼び戻されて、仙石氏の家督を継いだ。
sen.e: However, he was returned and took over the head of the family of the Sengoku clan, when his brothers died one after another.

sen.j: そして美濃斉藤氏に仕えたが、斎藤氏が信長によって滅ぼされると、信長の下で台頭していた豊臣秀吉の家臣として仕える。
sen.e: He served the Saito clan of Mino, but later became a vassal of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI who were gaining power under Nobunaga when the Sengoku clan was defeated by Nobunaga.

sen.j: 元亀元年（1570年）、姉川の戦いで浅井方の武将山崎新平を討ち取り、天正2年（1574年）には、秀吉から近江国野洲郡に1000石を与えられた。
sen.e: He killed Shinpei YAMAZAKI, a busho of the Azai clan's side in the Battle of Anegawa in 1570 and was granted by Hideyoshi 10,000 koku of rice of Yasu-gun, Omi Province in 1574,.

sen.j: （資料では「浅井方の兵」とあり、実際に部将クラスの人物であったかは不明）

sen.j: 天正6年（1578年）にはさらに4000石を加増される。
sen.e: He was further awarded an increase of 4000 koku in 1578.
He was further awarded an increase of 4000 koku in 1578.

sen.j: やがて秀吉が信長から中国征伐を命じられると、秀久はそれに従軍して戦功を挙げる。
sen.e: Before long, when Hideyoshi was ordered by Nobunaga to conquer the Chugoku Province, Hidehisa took part in the war and did distinguished service.
Before long, when Hideyoshi was ordered by Nobunaga to conquer the Chugoku Province, Hidehisa took part in the war and provided distinguished service.

sen.j: 天正7年(1579年)、秀吉から茶臼山城を任せられ、赤松峠を越える播磨道の警護に当たった。
sen.e: In 1579, he was entrusted by Hideyoshi management of Chausuyama-jo Castle to guard Harima-do Road that crosses over Akasaka-toge Mountain pass.
In 1579, Hideyoshi entrusted him with the management of Chausuyama-jo Castle in order to guard Harima-do Road that crossed over Akasaka-toge Mountain pass.

sen.j: また、この時期には秀吉が三木から幾度も通った湯山街道や有馬温泉を統括する湯山奉行にも任じられている。
sen.e: In this period, he was also appointed Yuyama buggy (magistrate) by Hideyoshi to manage Yuyama-kaido Highway and Arima-Onsen Hot Spring where Hideyoshi passed through many times.
In this period, he was also appointed Yuyama buggy (magistrate) by Hideyoshi to manage Yuyama-kaido Highway and Arima-Onsen Hot Spring where Hideyoshi passed through many times.

sen.j: さらに天正9年（1581年）には黒田孝高らと淡路島に渡って岩屋・由良城を陥落させた。
sen.e: In addition, in 1581, he went to Awaji-shima Island with Yoshitaka KURODA to conquer Iwaya Castle and Yura-jo Castle.
In addition, in 1581, he went to Awaji-shima Island with Yoshitaka KURODA to conquer Iwaya Castle and Yura-jo Castle.

sen.j: 天正10年（1582年）6月、信長が本能寺の変で死去、秀吉の中国大返しと山崎の戦いが始まった。
sen.e: In 1582, as soon as Nobunaga died in Honnoji Incident, Hideyoshi's Chugoku Ogaeshi (the term refers to the reaction to Honnoji Incident by Hideyoshi Hashiba, in which he rushed back to Bichu even though he was in a battle with Mitsuhide Akechi in Yamazaki which is near the boundary between Settsu Province and Yamashiro Province when he learnt the news) and the Battle of Yamazaki started.

sen.e: In 1582, as soon as Nobunaga died in the Honnoji Incident, Hideyoshi's Chugoku Ogaeshi (the term refers to the reaction to Honnoji Incident by Hideyoshi Hashiba, in which he rushed back to Bichu even though he was in a battle with Mitsuhide Akechi in Yamazaki which was near the boundary between Settsu Province and Yamashiro Province when he learnt the news) and the Battle of Yamazaki started.

In June 1582, as soon as Nobunaga died in the Honnoji Incident, Hideyoshi's Chugoku Ogaeshi (the term refers to the reaction to Honnoji Incident by Hideyoshi Hashiba, in which he rushed back to Bicchu even though he was in a battle with Mitsuhide Akechi in Yamazaki which was near the boundary between Settsu Province and Yamashiro Province when he learnt the news) and the Battle of Yamazaki started.
sen.cmt: Juneを挿入しました。BichuをBicchuに変更しました。

sen.j: 秀久は淡路で明智光秀方に与した豪族達を討伐する任にあたり、淡路平定に貢献した。
sen.e: Taking the responsibility of defeating Gozoku (local ruling families) in Awaji that took the side of Mitsuhide Akechi, Hidehisa contributed to the suppression of Awaji.

sen.j: その後、秀吉は織田氏筆頭家老の柴田勝家と賤ヶ岳の戦いで対立。
sen.e: Hideyoshi later confronted Katsuie SHIBATA, Hitto karo (the head of chief retainers) of the Oda clan in Battle of Shizugatake.

sen.j: 秀久も、羽柴秀勝とともに十二番隊の将として参戦する予定であった。
sen.e: Hidehisa planned to take part in the war as the head of the twelfth troop with HideKatsu HASHIBA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Hidehisa planned to take part in the war as the head of the twelfth battalion with HideKatsu HASHIBA.

sen.j: しかし長宗我部元親と共闘した菅達長に洲本城が占拠されたという報を聞きつけた秀吉は、秀久に四国勢の抑えとして急遽近江から淡路国に出向く命を与えた。
sen.e: However, hearing that Sumoto-jo Castle was seized by Michinaga KAN in alliance with Motochika CHOSOKABE, Hideyoshi ordered Hidehisa to hastily move from Omi to Awaji Province to suppress ruling families of Hiskoku.

sen.j: これにより、柴田側に与した四国の長宗我部元親と対陣することとなる。
sen.e: This is why Hidehisa confronted Motochika CHOSOKABE in Shikoku who came in on Shibata's side.

sen.j: 淡路入りした秀久は菅達長を破り、洲本城を奪還。
sen.e: Hidehisa who entered Awaji defeated Michinaga KAN and recovered the Sumoto-jo Castle.
Hidehisa who entered Awaji defeated Michinaga KAN and recovered the Sumoto-jo Castle.

sen.j: その後、小豆島を占拠し、十河存保の救援するために四国へ渡る。
sen.e: Later he occupied Shodo-shima Island and went over Shikoku to help Masayasu SOGO.
Later he occupied Shodo-shima Island and went over Shikoku to help Masayasu SOGO.

sen.j: 手始めに高松頼邑が守る喜岡城を攻めたが、落とせずに撤退。
sen.e: At first he attacked the Kioka-jo Castle guarded by Yorisato TAKAMATSU but was not successful in capturing it and retreated.
At first he attacked the Kioka-jo Castle guarded by Yorisato TAKAMATSU but unsuccessful in capturing it and retreated.

sen.j: ついで讃岐国引田に上陸、引田城に入城した。
sen.e: Then he landed Hiketa, Sanuki Province and entered the Hiketa Castle.
Then he landed in Hiketa, Sanuki Province and entering Hiketa Castle.

sen.j: 天正11年4月21日、長宗我部勢の香川信景らの部隊が押し寄せるも、秀久は伏兵で迎えうち、緒戦は優勢となる。
sen.e: On April 21,1583, Hidehisa fought to repulse the attack of the troops led by Nobukage KAGAWA of the Motochika CHOSOKABE's side and showed superior power in battles.
On April 21,1583, Hidehisa fought to repel an attack by troops led led by Nobukage KAGAWA of the Motochika CHOSOKABE's side, consequently besting them in battle.
On June 11,1583, Hidehisa fought to repel an attack by troops led by Nobukage KAGAWA of the Motochika CHOSOKABE's side, consequently besting them in battle.

sen.j: しかし数で優位な香川隊が態勢を立て直すと叙々に巻き返された。
sen.e: However, he was gradually forced to set back because Kagwa's troops gaining an advantage in number pulled themselves together.

sen.e: However, he was gradually forced to pull back because Kagawa's troops gained an advantage in numbers and pulled themselves together.

sen.j: 次いで駆けつけた長宗我部勢の援軍の攻撃により、引田城へ撤退。
sen.e: Subsequently, attacked by the troops that rushed to reinforce the Motochika CHOSOKABE's side, he withdrew to the Hikita Castle

sen.j: 翌22日に引田城は長宗我部軍の総攻撃を受け落城し、秀久は敗走する。
sen.e: On 22 April, the Hiketa Castle fell in an all-out attack of the Motochika CHOSOKABE's side, forcing Hidehisa to flee.

sen.j: （一説では、この戦いの最中に仙石軍は幟を取られるという失態を見せたといわれている）。
sen.e: (A version of the story has it that the Sengoku troop committed a blunder of being taken their flag during the fight.)

sen.j: 敗戦後は淡路と小豆島の守りを固め、瀬戸内の制海権維持に務めた。
sen.e: He strengthened the defenses of Awaji and Shodo-shima Island to maintain command of the sea of Setouchi.
He strengthened the defenses of Awaji and Shodo-shima Island to maintain control Setouchi sea.

sen.j: 天正11年（1583年）に賤ヶ岳の戦いが終結すると、秀久はこれまでの功を評価され、淡路国洲本城主5万石の大名となる。
sen.e: In 1583, when the Battle of Shizugatake ended, he became a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord), the lord of the Sumoto-jo Castle of Awaji Province with 50,000 goku of rice as the result of what Hidehisa had contributed.

In 1583, when the Battle of Shizugatake ended, he became a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord), the lord of the Sumoto-jo Castle of Awaji Province with 50,000 goku of rice as a result of what Hidehisa had contributed.

sen.j: 天正8年（1580年）との説もあるが、信長が淡路に平定軍として秀吉を派遣したのは天正9年（1581年）といわれているため、これは誤りである可能性が高い。
sen.e: Some suggest the Battle of Shizugatake ended in 1580, but this is highly unlikely to be true because it is said that Nobunaga dispatched Hideyoshi to Awaji as the troop to suppress Awaji in 1581.
sen.cmt: 「賤ヶ岳の戦いが終結するのは」を加えてあります。

sen.j: 淡路受領後は淡路水軍、小西行長、石井与次兵衛、梶原弥助の水軍を統括した。
sen.e: He unified the Awaji Navy with the Navies led by Yukinaga KONISHI, Yoshibe ISHI, and Yasuke KAJIWARA.

sen.j: 紀州討伐では湯川一族討伐で功を挙げた。
sen.e: He did a achievement in subjugation of Kishu by defeating the Yukawa family.

sen.e: He was successful in subjugating Kishu by defeating the Yukawa family.

sen.j: 第二次四国征伐の折には喜岡城を落とし、木津城攻めでは城の要を抑え、城内の水源を絶つなど活躍した。
sen.e: He also played an important role in the second subjugation of Shikoku by capturing the linchpin the Kioka-jo Castle and cutting off the water source of the castle.

sen.j: そして、天正13年（1585年）、四国征伐の功績により、秀吉から讃岐国高松10万石を与えられた。
sen.e: As the result of achievements in Shikoku Conquest, he was awarded by Hideyoshi Takamatsu, Sanuki Province with 100,000 goku of rice in 1585.

sen.j: 天正14年（1586年）、秀吉の命令で九州征伐が始まると、秀久は十河存保や長宗我部元親・長宗我部信親らの軍監として九州に渡海し、島津軍と対峙する。
sen.e: In 1586 when the Kyushu Conquest started by order of Hideyoshi, hidehisa sailed to Kyushu as Assistant Deputy General with Masayasu SOGO, Motochika CHOSOKABE, Nobuchika CHOSOKABE to confront Shimazu's army.

sen.j: 天正6年に長宗我部家に敗れ、城を落ち延びる。
sen.e: In 1578, he was defeated by the Chosokabe family but survived the fall of the castle.

sen.j: 後に仙石秀久に仕え、侍大将となる。
sen.e: He later served Hidehisa SENGOKU and became samurai daisho (a warrior who gives the order of battle and maneuvers the troops).

sen.j: 戸次川合戦敗北により秀久が失脚すると、かつての家臣の下に身を寄せた。
sen.e: He stayed at a house of his vassal, when Hidehisa lost his position after the defeat of the Battle of Hetsugigawa.

sen.j: 慶長8年7月4日没, 享年66。
sen.e: He died on July 4, 1578 at the age of 66.

sen.j: 一説に没落を悲しんでの入水自殺といわれている。
sen.e: Some suggest that he was killed himself for a grief of his fall
